intro: Stawellia dimorphantha, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Stawellia dimorphantha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
